title: Kuala Lumpur & Singapore
intro: Exploring the vibrant cultures of Malaysia and Singapore.

preTrip.title: Visas
preTrip.description: We processed our visas through VFS Global to ensure we had the necessary travel documents for both Malaysia and Singapore.

preTrip.title: Train Connection
preTrip.description: We took a train from Bangalore to Chennai to catch our connecting flight.

preTrip.title: Flights
preTrip.description: Our flights were booked via TigerAir, offering a convenient connection for our route.

preTrip.title: Currency & Forex
preTrip.description: We procured foreign currency (Malaysian Ringgit and Singapore Dollars) from a local Forex dealer before departure.

days.title: Bangalore to Chennai & Chennai to Singapore

items.title: Train Journey
items.description: Travel from Bangalore to Chennai for the connecting flight.

items.title: Flight Journey
items.description: We had flight at 11.45PM from Chennai and reached Singapore at around 6.30AM.

items.title: Singapore to Kuala Lumpur
items.description: We had a layover for 3 hours and then around 10.20 am departed from Singapre to Kuala Lumpur. We then took ERL express train to Bangsar.

items.title: Bangsar Homestay
items.description: We checked-in at around 12PM and settled down.

items.title: Aquaria KLCC
items.description: Around 2pm we visited Aquaria KLCC. Explore the oceanarium located beneath the Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre.

items.title: Menara KL Tower
items.description: Around 5pm we visited Menara KL Tower. Enjoy panoramic views of the city from the communications tower.

items.title: Petronas Twin Towers
items.description: Around 8pm we visited Petronas Twin Towers. Visit the iconic twin towers and the skybridge.

items.title: Batu Caves
items.description: We took a train to Batu Caves. Visit the limestone hill with a series of caves and cave temples.

items.title: Royal Selangor Visitor Centre
items.description: We took a train to Royal Selangor Visitor Centre. Learn about the history of pewter manufacturing.

items.title: Mahamariyamman Temple
items.description: We took a train to Mahamariyamman Temple. Visit the oldest Hindu temple in Kuala Lumpur.

items.title: Chinatown & Petaling Street
items.description: Explore the bustling street market and vibrant culture.

items.title: National Museum of Malaysia
items.description: Discover the rich history and heritage of Malaysia.

items.title: Cruise Tasik Putrajaya
items.description: Enjoy a scenic cruise on Putrajaya Lake.

items.title: Putrajaya Botanic Garden
items.description: Explore the beautiful gardens and botanical collections.

items.title: Sin Sze Si Ya Temple
items.description: Visit the Buddhist temple and learn about the history of Buddhism in Malaysia.

items.title: Geylang
items.description: We landed in Singapore and took a train card where we can preload the cash and travel. We then took a train to Geylang. Explore the local food scene and architecture.

items.title: Singapore Flyer
items.description: Ride the giant observation wheel for stunning views.

items.title: MICA Building
items.description: Admire the colorful windows of the Old Hill Street Police Station.

items.title: People of the River Sculptures
items.description: View the sculptures along the Singapore River.

items.title: Fort Canning Park
items.description: Walk through the historic hilltop park.

items.title: Peranakan Museum
items.description: Explore the culture of Peranakan communities.

items.title: National Museum of Singapore
items.description: Visit the oldest museum in Singapore.

items.title: Singapore Art Museum
items.description: View contemporary art from Singapore and Southeast Asia.

items.title: Little India
items.description: Experience the vibrant Indian culture and shops.

items.title: Mustafa Centre
items.description: Shop at the 24-hour shopping mall.

items.title: Srinivasa Perumal Temple
items.description: Visit the historic Hindu temple.

items.title: Jurong Bird Park
items.description: Visit Asia's largest bird park.

items.title: Singapore Zoo
items.description: Explore the world-famous 'open concept' zoo.

items.title: Night Safari
items.description: Experience the world's first nocturnal wildlife park.

items.title: Chinatown
items.description: Explore the historic district.

items.title: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple
items.description: Visit the impressive temple and museum.

items.title: Merlion Park
items.description: See the iconic Merlion statue.

items.title: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay
items.description: Visit the performing arts center.

items.title: Gardens by the Bay
items.description: Explore the futuristic park and Supertree Grove.

items.title: Singapore Cable Car
items.description: Take a scenic ride to Sentosa Island.

items.title: Sentosa Island
items.description: Enjoy the beaches and attractions.

items.title: Universal Studios Singapore
items.description: Enjoy the rides and attractions at the theme park.

items.title: Labrador Nature Reserve
items.description: Take a nature walk and see historical relics.

items.title: Wonder Full Light and Water Show
items.description: Watch the spectacular light and water show at Marina Bay Sands.

items.title: Changi Chapel and Museum
items.description: Learn about the history of WWII in Singapore.

items.title: Changi Beach Park
items.description: Relax at one of the oldest coastal parks in Singapore.

items.title: Depart to Bangalore
items.description: Depart to Bangalore.

weather.note: March in Kuala Lumpur and Singapore is hot and humid. It marks the end of the northeast monsoon season in Singapore, but expect consistent warmth and frequent showers in both cities.

expectations.description: Highs around 31-33°C (88-91°F) and lows around 23-24°C (73-75°F). Prepare for heat.
KL sees frequent rain (approx. 14 rainy days). Singapore is in a drier phase but still experiences short, daily showers.
Very high humidity (80%+) in both cities. It can feel muggy.
